events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of March 31, 2024, resulting in damage to the front bumper and hood of the vehicle.
The claim was categorized as an auto accident based on keywords related to vehicle damage and collision details submitted by the client.
An agent specializing in auto accident claims was assigned to handle this case in order to provide expert guidance and assistance.
The insured was sent an acknowledgment notice confirming receipt of their car accident claim and outlining the next steps.
Requested police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and insurance card copies from the claimant to proceed with investigation.
The insured submitted the police report, photos of the car damage, and a copy of their insurance card as requested.
Investigator was assigned to review submitted evidence, verify accident circumstances, and assess vehicle damages for the claim.
Investigation concluded after confirming insured’s account and damage assessment with no discrepancies found in submitted documents.
A settlement offer of $4500 was proposed to cover repairs for the front bumper, hood, and minor paint damage to the insured vehicle.
The insured confirmed acceptance of the settlement offer and expressed appreciation for the swift handling of their auto claim.
The claim was formally approved following acceptance of the settlement offer and verification of all required documentation.
Payment was issued to the claimant’s designated repair shop to cover the agreed settlement amount for vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirming all settlements and repair payments were processed successfully.
The claim and its documentation were archived in the system in compliance with company record-keeping policies.
